Package dog.giraffe.threads

Class Continuations

  • java.lang.Object
    • dog.giraffe.threads.Continuations
  • public class Continuations
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper methods to compose asynchronous computations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  Continuations.IntForks<T>
      Decomposition of a list of computations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static <T> Continuation<T> async​(Continuation<T> continuation, Executor executor)
      Returns a new continuation which on completion submits a task to the executor that completes the specified continuation the same way as it was completed.
      static <T> Continuation<T> finallyBlock​(Block block, Continuation<T> continuation)
      Returns a new continuation which on completion executes a block of code and than completes the specified continuation the same way as it was completed.
      static <T> void forkJoin​(Continuations.IntForks<T> forks, int forksFrom, int forksTo, Continuation<java.util.List<T>> join, Executor executor)
      Helper method for forkJoin(List, Continuation, Executor).
      static <T> void forkJoin​(java.util.List<AsyncSupplier<T>> forks, Continuation<java.util.List<T>> join, Executor executor)
      Executes all of the computations of forks in parallel.
      static <T,​U>
      Continuation<T>      		 map​(AsyncFunction<T,​U> function, Continuation<U> continuation)
      Maps the result of a computation.
      static <T> void sequence​(java.util.List<AsyncSupplier<T>> steps, Continuation<java.util.List<T>> continuation, Executor executor)
      Executes all of the computations of steps in sequentially.
      static <T> Continuation<T> singleRun​(Continuation<T> continuation)
      Returns a new continuation which can be completed at most once.

    • Method Detail

      • async

        public static <T> Continuation<T> async​(Continuation<T> continuation,
                                        Executor executor)
        Returns a new continuation which on completion submits a task to the executor that completes the specified continuation the same way as it was completed.

      • finallyBlock

        public static <T> Continuation<T> finallyBlock​(Block block,
                                               Continuation<T> continuation)
        Returns a new continuation which on completion executes a block of code and than completes the specified continuation the same way as it was completed. When the continuation was completed successfully and the block throws an exception the continuation will be completed as a failure.

      • forkJoin

        public static <T> void forkJoin​(java.util.List<AsyncSupplier<T>> forks,
                                Continuation<java.util.List<T>> join,
                                Executor executor)
                         throws java.lang.Throwable
        Executes all of the computations of forks in parallel. When all of the computations were successful then it will complete the join with the list of all of the results. The position of the results correspond to the positions of the suppliers in forks that generated it. When any of the computation has failed then it will complete the join unsuccessfully.
        Parameters:
        executor - the executor used to run all forks and the join
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • forkJoin

        public static <T> void forkJoin​(Continuations.IntForks<T> forks,
                                int forksFrom,
                                int forksTo,
                                Continuation<java.util.List<T>> join,
                                Executor executor)
                         throws java.lang.Throwable
        Helper method for forkJoin(List, Continuation, Executor). Executes all the tasks of forks in the interval [forksFrom, forksTo) in parallel. After all the forks completed it will complete join. The interval will be split uniformly into executor.threads() parts.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • map

        public static <T,​U> Continuation<T> map​(AsyncFunction<T,​U> function,
                                              Continuation<U> continuation)
        Maps the result of a computation. When the computation is successful it will run the function with the result which may produce a new value or fail. When the computation fails this will fail the continuation.

      • sequence

        public static <T> void sequence​(java.util.List<AsyncSupplier<T>> steps,
                                Continuation<java.util.List<T>> continuation,
                                Executor executor)
                         throws java.lang.Throwable
        Executes all of the computations of steps in sequentially. When all of the computations were successful then it will complete the join with the list of all of the results. The position of the results correspond to the positions of the suppliers in steps that generated it. When any of the computation has failed then it will complete the join unsuccessfully.
        Parameters:
        executor - the executor used to run all steps and the join
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • singleRun

        public static <T> Continuation<T> singleRun​(Continuation<T> continuation)
        Returns a new continuation which can be completed at most once. When the continuation is completed more than once it will raise an exception in the current thread.
